name: Create an H2H SFTP Push Job.txt - Beam push config file changes:-
description: This section explains the process of configuring and deploying an SFTP push job in the Beam application. It provides instructions on how to add a new push job configuration to the push_jobs.json file in the Beam repository, and how to securely store the authentication credentials (password, passphrase, or private key) in the credstash secret management system. It also outlines the steps to deploy the updated configuration to the production or staging environment using the CI/CD pipeline.
use_cases: Adding a new SFTP push job configuration to the Beam application
Securely storing and managing authentication credentials for SFTP push jobs
Deploying updated push job configurations to production or staging environments

name: Create an H2H SFTP Push Job.txt - Deploying your push config changes:-
description: This section explains the process of deploying configuration changes for an SFTP push job. It involves running a pipeline by providing the latest commit ID and clicking the 'Start manual Execution' button. Additionally, it mentions that in certain cases, banks or merchants may request Proof of Concept (POC) details from Razorpay, and the section provides guidance on the types of personnel information that can be shared in such scenarios.
use_cases: Deploying configuration changes for an SFTP push job
Running a pipeline with the latest commit ID
Providing Proof of Concept (POC) details to banks or merchants upon request
capabilities: Sharing personnel information (Account Manager, Team Manager, Support Manager/Finops Manager) for POC scenarios
